intro: Machaerina punctata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in Māori culture. Machaerina punctata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. It is a hardy perennial that can grow up to several meters in height.
